Attributes¶

Sampler.backend¶

An emcee.Backends object (see the emcee.Backends documentation for details). It is initialized (either from scratch or through an existing file) by the Sampler.__init_backend method.

  • type: emcee.Backends object

Sampler.backend_file¶

Name (with absolute path) of the emcee HDF5 backend file. It is set to Sampler.output_folder + "_backend.h5". See the emcee.Backends documentation for details about the emcee.Backends object.

  • type: str

Sampler.input_file¶

See input_file.

Sampler.input_folder¶

See input_folder.

Sampler.input_h5_file¶

See input_h5_file.

Sampler.input_log_file¶

See input_log_file.

Sampler.likelihood_script_file¶

Absolute path to the .py script containing the code necessary to intantiate a Lik object and define the corresponing parameters. The Sampler.__init_likelihood method loads it as a module, which instantiate a Lik object and defines parameters and logpdf. See the Sampler.__init__ method for details on how the attribute is set.

  • type: str or None

  • default: None

Sampler.log¶

See log.

Sampler.logpdf¶

Callable function that could accept x_pars either as a single point in parameter space corresponding to an array with shape (ndims,) or as a list of points corresponding to an array with shape (n_points,ndims) and that returns either a float or a list of computed logpdf values, depending on the input. In case of a scalar function the attribute Sampler.vectorize is automatically set to False. The function could also accept additional arguments args, passed through the Sampler.logpdf_args attribute. The attribute is assigned by the Sampler.__init_likelihood method.

  • type: callable

  • Could accept

    • x_par

      Values of the parameters for which logpdf is computed. It could be a single point in parameter space corresponding to an array with shape (ndims,) or a list of points corresponding to an array with shape (n_points,ndims).

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • possible shapes: (ndims,) or (n_points,ndims)

    • args

      List of additional arguments required by Sampler.logpdf and passed through the Sampler.logpdf_args attribute.

      • type: list or None

      • shape: (nargs,)

  • Could return

    Value or array of values of the logpdf.

    • type: float or numpy.ndarray

    • shape for numpy.ndarray: (n_points,)

Sampler.logpdf_args¶

Attribute containing a list of optional arguments (*args) for the logpdf function.

  • type: list or None

  • shape: (nargs,)

Sampler.logpdf_kwargs¶

Attribute containing a dictionary of optional keyword arguments (**kwargs) for the logpdf function.

  • type: dict or None

Sampler.moves¶

An emcee.moves object generated by evaluating the Sampler.moves_str attribute. See the emcee.moves documentation for details.

  • type: emcee.moves object

Sampler.moves_str¶

String representing an instance to an emcee.moves object. If None is passed, the default emcee.moves.StretchMove() is passed. See the emcee.moves documentation for details.

  • type: str or None

  • example: "[(moves.StretchMove(0.7), 0.2), (moves.GaussianMove(0.1, mode='random',factor=None),0.8)]"

    where moves represents the emcee.moves class. This gives a move that is 20% StretchMove with parameter 0.7 and 80% GaussianMove with covariance 0.1 and mode “random” (i.e. updating a single randomly chosen parameter at each step).

Sampler.name¶

See name.

Sampler.ndims¶

See ndims.

Sampler.nsteps_available¶

Number of MCMC steps available in the current Sampler.backend. When the object is loaded from files then, if nsteps_required is larger than Sampler.nsteps_available, then the Sampler.nsteps_required attribute is set equal to Sampler.nsteps_available.

  • type: int

Sampler.nsteps_required¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument nsteps_required and representing the final number of MCMC steps to run. When the object is loaded from files then, if nsteps_required is larger than Sampler.nsteps_available, then the Sampler.nsteps_required attribute is set equal to Sampler.nsteps_available. The attribute always represents the final number of steps, meaning that the sampling will always run for a number of steps given by the difference between Sampler.nsteps_required and Sampler.nsteps_available.

  • type: int

Sampler.nwalkers¶

Number of walkers (or chains) of the sampler. It is set from the input argument nwalkers. If the latter is None, then it is automatically set to twice the number of dimensions of the Sampler.logpdf function (given by the Sampler.ndims attribute).

  • type: int

Sampler.output_figures_base_file_name¶

See output_figures_base_file_name.

Sampler.output_figures_base_file_path¶

See output_figures_base_file_path.

Sampler.output_figures_folder¶

See output_figures_folder.

Sampler.output_folder¶

See output_folder.

Sampler.output_h5_file¶

See output_h5_file.

Sampler.output_json_file¶

See output_json_file.

Sampler.output_log_file¶

See output_log_file.

Sampler.output_predictions_json_file¶

See output_predictions_json_file.

Sampler.parallel_CPU¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument parallel_CPU. If True the MCMC is run in parallel on the available CPU cores, otherwise only a single core is used.

  • type: bool

Sampler.pars_bounds¶

See pars_bounds.

Sampler.pars_central¶

See pars_central.

Sampler.pars_init_vec¶

Array of points with parameters initialization for each walker. It is set by the Sampler.__init_likelihood method. This method tried to set parameters initialization from profiled maxima information available in the Likelihood object. If such information is not available or the number of local maxima is less than the required number points, then the missing points are generated with a standard normal smearing aroung the Sampler.pars_central value.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (nwalkers,ndims)

Sampler.pars_labels¶

See pars_labels.

Sampler.pars_labels_auto¶

See pars_labels_auto.

Sampler.pars_pos_nuis¶

See pars_pos_nuis.

Sampler.pars_pos_poi¶

See pars_pos_poi.

Sampler.predictions¶

Nested dictionary containing predictions computed with the

  • Sampler.compute_gelman_rubin

  • Sampler.plot_gelman_rubin

  • Sampler.plot_dist

  • Sampler.plot_chains

  • Sampler.plot_chains_logpdf

methods.

  • type: dict

Sampler.sampler¶

An emcee.EnsembleSampler object (see the emcee.EnsembleSampler documentation for details). It is initialized by the Sampler.__init_sampler method.

  • type: emcee.EnsembleSampler object

Sampler.vectorize¶

If True, the function Sampler.logpdf is expected to accept a list of points and to return a list of logpdf values. When it is set to True the Sampler.__check_vectorize checks the consistency by calling Sampler.logpdf on an array of points and, in case it fails, it sets Sampler.vectorize to False. When it is True, the Sampler.parallel_CPU attribute is automatically set to False. See the emcee.EnsembleSampler documentation for more details.

  • type: bool

Sampler.verbose¶

See verbose.
